meanings.sent1: The judge disannulled the unfair decision.
meanings.sent2: The contract was disannulled due to a mistake in the terms.
meanings.sent3: The magician disannulled the disappearing act by revealing the hidden compartment.
meanings.sent4: The storm disannulled all signs of the picnic that was set up in the park.
meanings.sent5: The eraser disannulled the mistake on the paper, leaving it clean.

meanings.sent1: She disannulled her subscription to the magazine.
meanings.sent2: The student disannulled his answer and chose a different one.
meanings.sent3: The chef disannulled the burnt dish by quickly preparing a fresh one.
meanings.sent4: The loud noise disannulled the peaceful atmosphere of the library.
meanings.sent5: The judge disannulled the marriage, declaring it null and void.
